extension.description: Linting support for Python files using Pylint.
settings.args.description: Arguments passed in to Pylint for linting Python files. Each argument should be provided as a separate string in the array.
settings.cwd.description: The current working directory used to lint Python files with Pylint. By default, it uses the root directory of the workspace `${workspaceFolder}`. You can set it to `${fileDirname}` to use the parent folder of the file being linted as the working directory for Pylint.
settings.severity.description: Mapping of Pylint's message types to VS Code's diagnostic severity levels as displayed in the Problems window. You can also use it to override specific Pylint error codes. E.g. `{ "convention": "Information", "error": "Error", "fatal": "Error", "refactor": "Hint", "warning": "Warning", "W0611": "Error", "undefined-variable": "Warning" }`
settings.lintOnChange.description: Enable linting Python files with Pylint as you type.
settings.path.description: Path or command to be used by the extension to lint Python files with Pylint. Accepts an array of a single or multiple strings. If passing a command, each argument should be provided as a separate string in the array. Note: Using this option may slowdown linting.
settings.ignorePatterns.description: Configure [glob patterns](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/glob-patterns) to exclude files or folders from being linted with Pylint.
settings.importStrategy.description: Defines which Pylint to be used to lint Python files. When set to `useBundled`, the extension will use the Pylint binary that is shipped with the extension. When set to `fromEnvironment`, the extension will attempt to use the Pylint binary and all dependencies that are available in the currently selected environment. Note: If the extension can't find a valid Pylint binary in the selected environment, it will fallback to using the Pylint binary that is shipped with the extension The `pylint.path` setting may also be ignored when this setting is set to `fromEnvironment`.
settings.importStrategy.useBundled.descr: Always use the bundled version of Pylint shipped with the extension.
Use Pylint from the selected environment. If the extension fails to find a valid Pylint binary, it will fallback to using the bundled version of Pylint.
settings.interpreter.description: Path to a Python executable or a command that will be used to launch the Pylint server and any subprocess. Accepts an array of a single or multiple strings.  When set to `[]`, the extension will use the path to the selected Python interpreter. If passing a command, each argument should be provided as a separate string in the array.
settings.showNotifications.description: Controls when notifications are shown by this extension.  Accepted values are `onError`, `onWarning`, `always` and `off`.
settings.showNotifications.off.descripti: Never display a notification. Any errors or warning are still available in the logs.
settings.showNotifications.onWarning.des: Show notifications for errors and warnings.
